intro: Diplotaxis catholica subsp. siifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved eragrostis, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other cruciferous plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stem and narrow, linear leaves. It produces small, yellow flowers that are arranged in racemes, and it is often found in dry, sandy soils. This subspecies is notable for its ecological role in supporting local insect populations and its resilience to arid conditions.
